f6_assessments.q0:
This is a proposal for the creation of a logistics and supply chain protocol that reduces the friction from the current tracking options and provides transperancy and efficiency at a significantly lower cost than current solutions on the market. The protocol will leverage in the future the DID trough Atala PRISM. A very important feat of the protocol will be to guard against counterfeiting. A second phase the proposal envisions a peer to peer e-comers platform integrated with the tracking protocol. 
The proposer explains the mechanism of the system in detail and clearly. 
The proposal includes explanation of the business model of the project and it Is nice to see that the proposer plans to bring revenue trough two different ways. A subscription model and a commission model. This is especially well aligned with the key metrics of the challenge.
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project has a developed proof of concept tracking protocol and it has a first client. Links to the client website and the website of the project are provided and functional.
The proposal is extremely well explained and it has a good action plan with a good timeline.
The budget of the proposal is very well detailed and very reasonable. For example the hourly rate for the developers is at half of the usual rates that we see in the proposals in Catalyst.
The founders of the project don’t take any of the funds provided by Catalyst. All funds are allocated to kick start the project.
The presentation of the team is very good. Linkedin links to their profiles are provided and functional. The team appears to have the knowledge and experience to deliver the project to success.
I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability section of the project is very good. It is one of the best I have seen this und. It uses the timeline/roadmap as a backbone, but attached to the timeline there are concrete benchmarks against which any auditor could compare the progress of the project.
The success indicators for the project also have concrete numbers attached to them so there is a clear benchmark to see if the project is successful or not.
I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal involves the creation of a tracking solution and supply chain management with the help of the Cardano blockchain. Hence it is well-aligned with the Challenge statement as it is providing B2B and B2C business solutions.
As stated there is a need for a tracking solution due to huge losses suffered by multiple businesses and customers due to the counterfeited products, especially in the agri-food sector. This proposal will bring real-life utility to the Cardano blockchain. It is going to use Cardano’s Atala Prism to smoothen the onboarding process by utilizing its decentralized identity feature. If successful this protocol will help grow the Cardano ecosystem, especially in Italy. 
 
The target location of this proposal is Italy and upon successful execution, this protocol will have the ability to scale. The proposer as stated is going to expand their operations to Tanzania and Ethiopia in the long run.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team seems to be capable to carry out this proposal along with the help of ‘Hinnovo’ a software development company. The LinkedIn profiles of all the team members are shared for reference. As reflected from the LinkedIn profiles some of the team members are freshers/students but hopefully, that experience void will be filled by their enthusiasm, experienced team members, and their partnership with Hinnovo.
The plan has been laid with details in different phases. As in phase 1, the tracking services will be provided and in phase 2 e-commerce services will be added. As stated the later stage will be funded with the help of Initial Stake Pool Offering. The stake delegators will be airdropped with protocol’s Cardano native token ‘GYQ’. The whole business model along with the plan looks quite sound as each phase is explained well. 
The budget requested seems to be reasonable. It has been broken down into identifiable tasks, as well as the duration to complete these tasks are given.
The proposer is well aware of the risks and challenges to complete this proposal. One of the challenges as stated is slow penetration which I think can be overcome with extensive marketing to businesses/customers the benefits of tracking-based e-commerce systems to avoid counterfeited products.
 Because of the above facts, this proposal seems to be executed successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress of this proposal can be easily audited/ tracked with the help of the various metrics, milestones, and timeframes supplied by the proposer.
The milestones have been divided into three stages i.e., a) 3 Months b) 6 months & c) 12 months. This will help to measure the progress of this protocol. Hence the roadmap has been laid out clearly with details. The major milestones are the introduction of the tracking system, mobile Dapp release, desktop Dapp, ISPO, GYQ token airdrop, introduction of e-commerce platform, and onboarding of businesses and customers to the platform. 
 
 The KPIs such as the number of customers/businesses using the tracking system, the number of products tracked using Cardano & also the number of products sold by using this protocol can be considered to quantify the success of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The given challenge aims at finding out Cardano-based solutions that help solve business needs.And this proposal suggested a solution that is quite aligned with the challenge. Stemming from the need of businesses, specifically firms in the sector of Italia agri-food which is the first target object of this project, that they want to track and trace the origin or the authenticity of all ingredients that will make up the final products to assure the high quality of their offerings. The proposal suggested Logyq Protocol,  a Cardano’s DApp, which allows anyone to track the products' origin or shipment. This is, to some extent, what businesses are seeking to improve their business efficiency and motivate the adoption of e-commerce solutions as well. The proposal also did greatly in describing its products, its functions, features, how it works, and how it brings benefit to users thanks to Cardano blockchain including technical information. In short, the suggested solution satisfied the challenge to some extent and it also showed its impact on a  lot of stakeholders and in some indirect ways enhanced the development of the Cardano ecosystem. Another highlight is that the proposal did an excellent job in listing three challenges that this project is likely to face in the process of delivering it such as the slow adoption of Cardano and its ecosystem, entry barriers like languages, and legal issues. And the solutions for these potential challenges were clarified in great detail.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal completed an excellent task in providing a very detailed plan and a clear timeline as well. It separated the plan and the timeline into 2 distinct sections. It described how every step in the plan would proceed, and the purpose of doing everything in that order. In this explanation of how the plan would be executed, some main milestones were also mentioned as well. After that, a detailed timeline was listed. Some summarized tasks need to be done in each period of time. This showed the proposer put a lot of effort into preparing such a complete, clear, understandable, and easy-to-follow plan. Another compliment for this proposal is that the budget distribution was listed specifically. Several types of costs were given. There is just a small point that this proposal could improve is that some of the costs were mentioned, but there is no indication of how long they would be used for. Overall, the budget breakdown was quite well given. Though there was the involvement of university students in the project, they are all young, talented, have a passion for blockchain and accumulate some experience in blockchain technology. Lucus is just an engineering student, but has got 2 years of experience in blockchain engineering and smart-contract programming, and used to work in DeFI startup. Alessio, an Economics student, is the founder of  Criptolab, a coworking space that holds blockchain and crypto-themed meetups. Although the team of this project is still young, they get support from Hinnovo, a software development company that provides skills in front-end and back-end development and blockchain engineering capabilities. Therefore, this project is still quite feasible and prospective with young and gifted people along with the help from a software firm.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal did a great job in listing KPIs and the roadmap with clear time milestones. This roadmap is totally aligned with the plan given in the previous section, which is a great point to show the synchronization of the proposal. Thanks to this, it makes it easier to follow, track, trace, and audit this project. Everything provided seems to be quite transparent and appropriate. f6_assessments.q0: This proposal raises an intriguing dilemma. There is a problem with counterfeiting and selling counterfeit items, according to the team. The act is becoming increasingly sensitive, and there is no means of knowing whether it was counterfeit or not. Proposal indicates statistics from studies related to the problem of counterfeit goods to reinforce the need to solve the problem. The team plans to introduce Logyq Protocol, a logistics and supply chain protocol based on Cardano blockchain that anyone may use, to address this challenge. If properly implemented, Logyq will give a simple, user-friendly interface that will allow anyone to trace their product's provenance and shipment, making it easier to locate buyers and commercial partners. I consider both the problem and the solution to be relevant, as well as the success metrics that are being proposed to be both suitable and in line with what this challenge is seeking. A full overview of steps to take to success and an explanation on how Logyq protocol will work making this proposal much more trust-worthy. In my opinion, the idea is ambitious but it would have been nice if the proposal directly mentioned why and how the Cardano ecosystem will grow or have a positive impact.

f6_assessments.q2: Seeing the proposer recognize the potential risks of tackling an issue like counterfeiting items and suggest possible methods to overcome them makes me believe that the proposer has a thorough understanding of what the team is doing, which boosts the proposal's trust and credibility. The proposing team has a clear idea of what they want to accomplish and a plan to get there. f6_assessments.q0:
The main purpose of this proposal is to build a tracking protocol on top of the Cardano blockchain, that will enable anyone to trace products through the supply chain by using mobile and/or desktop apps.
It will benefit both vendors, who by being able to prove their authenticity, can gain access to larger markets, financing and proving a clear record of accountability, as well as for customers, who will be able to check the authenticity and/or record of ingredients that went into a final product.
Having such a protocol being built and ready to be implemented for any company/vendor to use can have a great impact on the Cardano ecosystem, especially since the proposers are already in talks with and Italian wine vendor, who is willing to test the platform for a proof of concept. The Italian market is well suited for an initial implementation of product tracking, especially the wine and cheese markets, that are heavily relying on authenticity and product provenance marketing.

f6_assessments.q0:
Supply chain tracking and optimization is a very natural application of blockchain technology for its inherent transparency, reliability and traceability. As someone who's been doing ML consulting for Manufacturing and supply chain industry, I think the goal this proposal tries to achieve is a fundamental step towards real-world application of Cardano, given the successful execution of the plan. Having visibility and traceability into product components and shipments will enable the producers and SMEs at these emerging companies to better plan for product cycles, manage production plan and inventory accordingly to minimize waste and maximize profits, bringing true values to those needing it and probably deserves them the most. 

On the other hand, I do want to explicitly mention some challenges that might not have been extensively addressed by the proposal yet and personally what I think some of the real challenges still existing for an end-to-end scalable blockchain solutions: 

- Many companies are just at the cusp of transforming into Industry 4.0, meaning they are starting to digitalize their services and employ IoTs for various applications. I think IoT tracking service is a key factor in this solutions in order to render true visibility. Given complex shipping logistics in modern supply chain, having too many manual touch points in the process likely will not be able to scale the solution.
- Scalability of the Cardano network. While multiple scaling solutions are underway and will be released gradually this year such as increased block size, Hydra and possible rollup solutions, to handle the large amount of transactions and shipping information of millions of items on a daily base as a E-commerce platform will require a truly scalable solution. 

Hope these points are helpful for the team when considering factors during the solution design.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposal is important and addresses a core problem, I have a neutral position on the feasibility of the solution, given the competitive market space dominated by major logistics companies and some inherent technological challenge.  The diverse background of the founding team is inspiring, but I don't see members with extensive supply chain background to help navigate through various challenges in this space. Having access to experts in this domain, in my opinion, will increase the likelihood of success of the proposal and hope the team can leverage the resources existing in current Universities or other channels to do so.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposed metrics are tangible, concrete and easy to track. Sharing first customer success story and apply the learning to embark additional customers in first three months is a crucial step to ensure following successes. It would be helpful to help communities understand better about the landscape of challenges in supply chain in general and how blockchain and complementary technologies can be adopted to solve those problems is something I would love to see in the white paper.
